full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Resource Scheduling SaaS Solution for the RCMP Academy Training Programs at RCMP Depot Division
### Contract Title
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites bidders to participate in a Request for Proposal (RFP) to provide a software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution to manage resource scheduling and training programs at the RCMP Depot Division.

### Contract Awarded in Language
The RFP will be released in English and French.

### Bidding Information
- **Bidding Timeline**:
  - **Publication Date:** May 10, 2024
  - **Tender Closing Date:** June 12, 2024, 16:00:00 (local time)
- **Contract Duration**: The initial contract period will be one year with an option to extend for up to four additional one-year periods.

### Contract Requirements
- **Product Description**:
  - The commercially available SaaS must be capable of managing resource scheduling and training programs for approximately 30 users, including:
    - Access to the resource scheduling SaaS solution
    - Software maintenance and support
    - User training
    - Compliance with security assessment and authorization (SA&A) requirements
- **Integrity Regime**:
  - The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions must be adhered to as outlined in this solicitation.

## Awarding Procedure
- **Selection Criteria**:
  - To be declared responsive, a bid must:
    1. Comply with all requirements outlined in the RFP
    2. Meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria
    3. Obtain a minimum of 10 points overall for the technical evaluation criteria
- **Winner Selection**:
  - The responsive bid with the highest combined rating of technical merit and price will be recommended for award.

### Contact Information
- **Bidding Officer**:
  - Name: Qyitayo Ziwa
  - Email: Qyitayo.ziwa@rcmp-grc.gc.ca
  - Phone: 1-639-625-4151

### Indigenous Procurement
- **Federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD)**:
  - Bidders are encouraged to review the IBD to increase their company's visibility and compete for federal government contracts reserved for Indigenous businesses.

Please refer to the attached tender documents for further information. All submitted bids must be sent to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at NWR_Procurement
